Service Interconnect is a layer 7 networ: Service Interconnect is a layer 7 network. It enables secure communication across Kubernetes clusters with no VPNs or special firewall rules
The site console is used during network: The site console is used during network setup.

A listener is a local connection endpoin: A listener is a local connection endpoint that is associated with remote servers. Listeners expose a host and port for accepting connections. Listeners use a routing key to forward connection data to remote connectors.
A connector binds local servers (pods, c: A connector binds local servers (pods, containers, or processes) to connection listeners in remote sites. Connectors are linked to listeners by a matching routing key.
It appears that you are using an older v: It appears that you are using an older version to ensure full functionality and compatibility with all site plugins.

tooltipSiteName: The name of the site resource
tooltipSiteLinkAccess: Enable external access for links from remote sites. The default value is route if the environment is OpenShift, otherwise loadbalancer.
tooltipServiceAccount: The Kubernetes service account under which to run the Skupper controller. The default value is skupper:skupper-controller
tooltipRedemptionAllowed: The number of times an access token for this grant can be redeemed.
tooltipExpirationWindow: The period of time in which an access token for this grant can be redeemed.
tooltipCode: The secret code used to authenticate access tokens submitted for redemption. If not set, a value for the code field in the status is generated.
tooltipRoutingKey: The identifier used to route traffic from listeners to connectors. To expose a local workload to a remote site, the remote listener and the local connector must have matching routing keys.
tooltipPort: The port on the target workload to forward traffic to.
tooltipConnectorSelector: A Kubernetes label selector for specifying target server pods. On Kubernetes, you usually want to use this. As an alternative, you can use host.
tooltipConnectorHost: The hostname or IP address of the server. This is an alternative to selector for specifying the target server.
tooltipTlsCredentials: The name of a Kubernetes secret containing the trusted server certificate (typically a CA). It can optionally include a client certificate and key for mutual TLS. This option is used when setting up client-to-router TLS encryption.
tooltipListenerHost: The hostname or IP address of the local listener. Clients at this site use the listener host and port to establish connections to the remote service.

Include server pods that are not in the: Include server pods that are not in the ready state
